proficiency_choices.desc: Choose two from Animal Handling, Athletics, Intimidation, Nature, Perception, and Survival

starting_equipment_options.desc: (a) a greataxe or (b) any martial melee weapon
(a) two handaxes or (b) any simple weapon

features.name: Frenzy
features.desc: When you rage, you can choose to go into a frenzy. For the duration of your rage, you can make a single melee weapon attack as a bonus action on each of your turns after this one. When your rage ends, you suffer one level of exhaustion.

features.name: Mindless Rage
features.desc: You can't be charmed or frightened while raging. If you are charmed or frightened when you enter your rage, the effect is suspended for the duration of the rage.

features.name: Intimidating Presence
features.desc: You can use your action to frighten someone with your menacing presence. Choose one creature you can see within 30 feet. If the creature can see or hear you, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC 8 + proficiency bonus + Charisma modifier) or be frightened until the end of your next turn. You can extend the effect on subsequent turns. If the creature succeeds, you can't use this feature on that creature again for 24 hours.

features.name: Retaliation
features.desc: When you take damage from a creature within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against that creature.

paths.name: Path of the Juggernaut
paths.desc: Juggernauts represent the finest of frontline destroyers. Thunderous Blows: Once per turn while raging, when you damage a creature with a melee attack, you can force the target to make a Strength saving throw. Stance of the Mountain: You cannot be knocked prone while raging unless you become unconscious. Demolishing Might: All of your melee attacks gain the siege property. Overwhelming Cleave: When you make a weapon attack while raging, you can make another attack as a bonus action with the same weapon against a different creature. Unstoppable: When you rage, your speed cannot be reduced, and you are immune to the frightened, paralyzed, and stunned conditions.

paths.name: Path of Booming Magnificence
paths.desc: Barbarians who walk this path strive to be as lions among their people. Roar of Defiance: Unleash a thunderous roar as part of the bonus action you take to enter your rage. Running Leap: While raging, you can leap further. Lion's Glory: When you enter your rage, you can choose a number of allies that can see you to gain bonus damage. Resonant Bellow: End the frightened condition on yourself and allies. Victorious Roar: When you hit with at least two attacks, unleash a victorious roar to frighten a creature.

paths.name: Path of Hellfire
paths.desc: Devils grant power to mortals as part of a pact. Hellish Aspect: When you enter your rage, you take on minor fiendish aspects and gain resistance to fire damage. Hell's Vengeance: Punish enemies who damage your allies. Hellfire Shield: Surround yourself with flames when you rage. Devilish Essence: Advantage on saving throws against spells and gain temporary hit points when damaged by spells.

paths.name: Path of Mistwood
paths.desc: Masters of the forests, often elves. Bonus Proficiency: Gain proficiency in Stealth. Mistwood Defender: Use Reckless Attack on ranged attacks with thrown weapons. From the Mist: Cast misty step and make a thrown weapon attack. Mist Dance: Attack each creature within 5 feet. War Band's Passage: Bring allies with you when you cast misty step.

paths.name: Path of the Dragon
paths.desc: Emulate the power and majesty of dragons. Totem Dragon: Choose a dragon type and gain resistance to its damage type. Wyrm Teeth: Make a bite attack while raging. Legendary Might: Succeed on a failed saving throw once per long rest. Aspect of the Dragon: Manifest draconic features while raging. Wyrm Lungs: Use a breath weapon attack.

paths.name: Path of the Herald
paths.desc: Lead people into battle, chanting sagas. Oral Tradition: Gain proficiency in History and Performance. Battle Fervor: Allow allies to enter rage. Lorekeeper: Cast augury, comprehend languages, or identify as a ritual. Bolstering Chant: Regain hit points when ending rage. Thunderous Oratory: Attacks deal extra thunder damage.

paths.name: Path of the Inner Eye
paths.desc: Elevate rage to glimpse premonitions of the future. Anticipatory Stance: Can't be surprised unless incapacitated. Insightful Dodge: Move to avoid attacks while raging. Foretelling Tactics: Allies can move and attack when you hit a creature. Preemptive Parry: Force attackers to reroll and reduce damage.

paths.name: Path of Thorns
paths.desc: Grow thorns all over the body. Blossoming Thorns: Unarmed strikes deal piercing damage. Thorned Grasp: Grapple deals piercing damage. Nature's Blessing: Thorns count as magical. Toxic Infusion: Infuse thorns with toxins. Thorn Barrage: Shoot thorns at nearby creatures.
